snippet: A retiring senator refused to drop his opposition to an extraneous measure that had been added at the last minute by House Republicans.
abstract: Senate rejects Terrorism Risk Insurance Act after Sen Tom Coburn refuses to drop his opposition to extraneous measure that had been added at last minute by House Republicans; act, if passed, would have extended federal terrorism insurance for six more years, raising damage threshold from $100 million to $200 million.
lead_paragraph: A retiring senator refused to drop his opposition to an extraneous measure that had been added at the last minute by House Republicans.

headline.main: Terrorism Insurance Is Rejected in the Senate
headline.print_headline: Terrorism Insurance Is Rejected in the Senate
